produccionBibliograficaPOJO.titulo: Conflicting Sovereignties: Global Conservation, Protected Areas, and Indigenous Nations in the Peruvian Amazon
Extractive Constitutions: Constitutional Change and Development Paths in Latin America
The Geopolitics of Food Security and Food Sovereignty in Latin America: Harmonizing Competing Visions or Reinforcing Extractive Agriculture?
Between the environment and the economy: foreign investments, global conservation, and Indigenous nations in the Amazon
A Decolonial Approach to Innovation? Building Paths Towards Buen Vivir
Localizing the indigenous environmental steward norm: The making of conservation and territorial rights in Peru
Buen vivir and the Making of Indigenous Territories in the Peruvian Amazon
The land of nations: Indigenous struggles for property and territory in international law
Domestication of international norms for sustainable resource governance: Elite capture in Peru
Rethinking Indigenous Politics: The Unnoticed Struggle for Self-Determination in Peru
The cynical state: forging extractivism, neoliberalism and development in governmental spaces
Reimagining the nation-state: Indigenous peoples and the making of plurinationalism in Latin America
Re-politicizing participation or reframing environmental governance? Beyond indigenous’ prior consultation and citizen participation
An alternative to ‘alternative development’?: Buen vivir and human development in Andean countries
The politics of extractive governance: Indigenous peoples and socio-environmental conflicts
Decolonizing property rights: Indigenous communal rights and the private property paradigm
